newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM TO LAUNCH THREE NEW DESTINATIONS.
newsitem.headline: KLM TO LAUNCH THREE NEW DESTINATIONS.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines said on Tuesday it would launch three new destinations on October 27.
San Juan in Puerto Rico; Baku, the capital of Azerbeijan and Bologna in Italy are the trio to be launched as KLM embarks on its winter schedule, a spokesman said.
Though the moves are largely driven by the tourist market, there will be considerable cargo capacity available, he said.
San Juan will be operated twice-weekly with an MD-11, via St.Martin. The aircraft has a capacity of around ten to 15 tons, depending on its passenger lift.
Cargo expected on the route includes pharmaceuticals, chemicals, footwear and electronics, the spokesman said.
A Boeing 767 will be deployed on the Baku route and this destination will be operated three times a week. Baku has been added because of the oil, gas and mineral industry in the area.
Spare parts and mining equipment for explorations in the area are likely to be the major cargo consignments.
Bologna, will be KLM's fifth destination in Italy and it will be operated twice-daily with a Fokker 70.
KLM will also increase its Atlanta flights from four to five per week from January. Taipei flights will rise to six a week.
Accra, in Ghana, also gets an additional frequency from December 3, bringing the service up to four times a week.
